001package com.technototes.library.control;
002
003import com.technototes.library.command.Command;
004import com.technototes.library.command.CommandScheduler;
005import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
006
007/**
008 * Class for gamepad-command integration
009 *
010 * @param <T> The type of Gamepad Button
011 * @author Alex Stedman
012 */
013public interface CommandInput<T extends ButtonBase> extends BooleanSupplier {
014    /**
015     * Schedule a command to be run once the input is pressed.
016     *
017     * @param command The command to be run
018     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
019     */
020    default T whenPressed(Command command) {
021        return schedule(getInstance()::isJustPressed, command);
022    }
023
024    /**
025     * Schedule a command to be run once the input is released.
026     *
027     * @param command The command to be run
028     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
029     */
030    default T whenReleased(Command command) {
031        return schedule(getInstance()::isJustReleased, command);
032    }
033
034    /**
035     * Schedule a command to be run over &amp; over while the input is pressed,
036     * but once it's released, the command will be cancelled.
037     *
038     * @param command The command to be run
039     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
040     */
041    default T whilePressed(Command command) {
042        return schedule(getInstance()::isPressed, command.cancelUpon(getInstance()::isReleased));
043    }
044
045    /**
046     * Schedule a command to be run over &amp; over while the input is released,
047     * but once it's pressed, the command will be cancelled.
048     *
049     * @param command The command to be run
050     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
051     */
052    default T whileReleased(Command command) {
053        return schedule(getInstance()::isReleased, command.cancelUpon(getInstance()::isPressed));
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * Schedule a command to be run while the input is pressed, but only once,
058     * and if the command takes so long that the input is released, the command
059     * will be cancelled.
060     *
061     * @param command The command to be run
062     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
063     */
064    default T whilePressedOnce(Command command) {
065        return schedule(
066            getInstance()::isJustPressed,
067            command.cancelUpon(getInstance()::isReleased)
068        );
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * Schedule a command to be run over &amp; over while the input is pressed
073     *
074     * @param command The command to be run
075     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
076     */
077    default T whilePressedContinuous(Command command) {
078        return schedule(getInstance()::isPressed, command);
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * Schdule the command to be run when the input is released, but only once!
083     *
084     * @param command The command to be run
085     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
086     */
087    default T whileReleasedOnce(Command command) {
088        return schedule(
089            getInstance()::isJustReleased,
090            command.cancelUpon(getInstance()::isPressed)
091        );
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Schedule a command to be run when the input was just toggled
096     * (From pressed to released, or released to pressed)
097     *
098     * @param command The command to be run
099     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
100     */
101    default T whenToggled(Command command) {
102        return schedule(getInstance()::isJustToggled, command);
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Schedule the command to be run when the input has only stopped being toggled
107     *
108     * @param command The command to be run
109     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
110     */
111    default T whenInverseToggled(Command command) {
112        return schedule(getInstance()::isJustInverseToggled, command);
113    }
114
115    /**
116     * Schedule the command to be run while the input is changing.
117     * It will be canceled once the input is not changing.
118     * This is questionably useful, as toggling over &amp; over is a 'frequency' problem.
119     * I expect this is going to behave almost the same as whenToggled...
120     *
121     * @param command The command to be run
122     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
123     */
124    default T whileToggled(Command command) {
125        return schedule(
126            getInstance()::isToggled,
127            command.cancelUpon(getInstance()::isInverseToggled)
128        );
129    }
130
131    /**
132     * Schedule the command to run over &amp; over while the input is *not* changing
133     * It will be canceled once the input is toggled.
134     *
135     * @param command The command to be run repetetively
136     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
137     */
138    default T whileInverseToggled(Command command) {
139        return schedule(
140            getInstance()::isInverseToggled,
141            command.cancelUpon(getInstance()::isToggled)
142        );
143    }
144
145    /**
146     * Return instance of class parameter
147     *
148     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
149     */
150    T getInstance();
151
152    /**
153     * Schedule the command to run over &amp; over
154     *
155     * @param condition The condition
156     * @param command   The command to schedule
157     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
158     */
159    default T schedule(BooleanSupplier condition, Command command) {
160        CommandScheduler.getInstance().scheduleJoystick(command, condition);
161        return getInstance();
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * Schedule the command to run
166     *
167     * @param command The command
168     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
169     */
170    default T schedule(Command command) {
171        return schedule(() -> true, command);
172    }
173
174    /**
175     * For scheduling a pair commands for when the input is pressed and released.
176     * 'press' will be executed once when the input is pressed.
177     * 'release' will be executed once when the input is released.
178     *
179     * @param press   The command to run on Press
180     * @param release The command to run on Release
181     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
182     */
183    default T whenPressedReleased(Command press, Command release) {
184        whenPressed(press);
185        return whenReleased(release);
186    }
187
188    /**
189     * For scheduling a pair commands for while the input is pressed and released.
190     * 'press' will be executed over &amp; over while the input is pressed.
191     * 'release' will be exeucted over &amp; over while the input is released.
192     *
193     * @param press   The command to run on Press
194     * @param release The command to run on Release
195     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
196     */
197    default T whilePressedReleased(Command press, Command release) {
198        whilePressed(press);
199        return whileReleased(release);
200    }
201
202    /**
203     * For scheduling a pair of "opposite" commands for toggling when something
204     * is or is not being toggled
205     *
206     * @param toggle  The command to run when the input flips states
207     * @param itoggle The command to run when the input has not changed states
208     * @return The CommandInput&lt;T&gt; instance
209     */
210    default T toggle(Command toggle, Command itoggle) {
211        whenToggled(toggle);
212        return whenInverseToggled(itoggle);
213    }
214}
